TopicTitle: Undo button in the vehicule assembly

Articles.Content:
Sorry I didn't red anything about a undo button for vehicule assembly. I can't beleave I'm the only one crying when I miss cliked on my ship and had long minutes reluilding it.

Please tell me I'm not alone ^^
Just know that sometimes it seems like ctrl-z isn't working, but it's just slow. I think it also helps if the cursor is not on the parts list, IIRC
Ctrl-z and Ctrl-y works, but careful when using it, especially with high part count craft. I feel like it is trying to rebuild the whole craft every time you do that.

> 
> Ctrl-z and Ctrl-y works, but careful when using it, especially with high part count craft. I feel like it is trying to rebuild the whole craft every time you do that.

Yeah, it does seems to function strangely. Makes the game hang on my higher part craft.
Event with the CTRL+Z/Y, it would be cool to have a button. Let's think as new players !

Ctrl-Z/Ctrl-Y got a lot more reliable in 0.90. In previous versions it would sometimes forget staging or mess up struts/fuel lines but in the latest it works very well, if a bit slowly when you manipulate a lot of parts with it.

> 
> Event with the CTRL+Z/Y, it would be cool to have a button. Let's think as new players !

I agree, an undo button would be good.

> 
> Just know that sometimes it seems like ctrl-z isn't working, but it's just slow. I think it also helps if the cursor is not on the parts list, IIRC

If you are not sure, just watch the yellow vehicles that are whizzing on the ground of the VAB/SPH (or the kerbals, if you have them turned on) - if they freeze, the revert/redo process is happening. If they continue walking, something is wrong (you either have nothing to revert/redo or are pressing the wrong button combination).
